summary: This is a service request form from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, detailing a request to install and troubleshoot a new NICE Vision surveillance camera system. The request is marked as an emergency and involves adding Vicon V942D cameras to the network.

persons.name: Jeff Craw

persons.context: Listed as a service contractor assigned to the request and also as the primary contact for the Federal Bureau of Prisons for this service call.

connections.description: Both are listed as service contractors assigned to the same surveillance system installation project at MCC New York.
Both are listed as service contractors assigned to work on the surveillance system installation at MCC New York on September 20, 2019.

events.title: Surveillance System Service Request
events.description: An emergency service request is created for the installation and network troubleshooting of a new NICE Vision surveillance camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

locations: Federal Bureau of Prisons MCC New York MS0109 (130104.001)
keyFacts: This document is a service request form related to the installation of a NICE Vision surveillance camera system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, which is a Federal Bureau of Prisons facility.
The request is marked as an emergency and involves troubleshooting Vicon V942D cameras to integrate them into the NICE Vision system via ONVIF protocol.
The service was scheduled for September 20, 2019, between 8-11am, and assigned to contractors Jeff Cranor, Justin Houston, and Jeff McKenzie.
The document provides a specific address for the MCC New York facility: 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007.
